rename.from: ERROR on first responder set to nil on OSX 10.12 (Sierra)
rename.to: Error on first responder set to nil on 10.12 Sierra

body: @sp-erik-podetti What is the error and how would I go about reproducing it?

issue.title: Fix 'first responder' error on 10.12

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
Error message is displayed during the startup because Cocoa view is set as the first responder for window but this view isn't in this window (actually it is not in any window at all).

Fixes the issue described in #876. **Tested only on macOS 10.12.**

body: This has been fixed with #883. Thank you for reporting it!

issue.title: TODO: hunter-packages

repository.name: drishti
repository.description: Real time eye tracking for embedded and mobile devices.

issue.body:
- [x] https://github.com/hunter-packages/sse2neon (acf)
- [x] https://github.com/hunter-packages/ARM_NEON_2_x86_SSE (core)
- [ ] https://github.com/hunter-packages/ogles_gpgpu
- [x] imshow : add texture access to api + support nonContinuous
- [x] glfw : update to 3.3 to prevent Mac OS Sierra warning (occasional crash) https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/876#issuecomment-254043008

```
2017-03-31 23:14:53.278493 test-ogles_gpgpu[66374:19119633] [General] ERROR: Setting <GLFWContentView: 0x100c2dd10> as the first responder for window <GLFWWindow: 0x100b0b3a0>, but it is in a different window ((null))! This would eventually crash when the view is freed. The first responder will be set to nil.
(
	0   AppKit                              0x00007fffba1f8114 -[NSWindow _validateFirstResponder:] + 566
	1   AppKit                              0x00007fffb99747ff -[NSWindow _setFirstResponder:] + 31
	2   AppKit                              0x00007fffb9a1ca22 -[NSWindow _realMakeFirstResponder:] + 406
	3   AppKit                              0x00007fffb9a1c838 -[NSWindow makeFirstResponder:] + 123
	4   test-ogles_gpgpu                    0x0000000100106dee createWindow + 1230
```

issue.title: Pr.3.3.0

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, window and input

issue.body:
@pretyman, @ruslo : Please review for merge.

Update to 3.3.0

Notably, this fixes Mac OS Sierra warning/errors described here:
https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/876#issuecomment-254043008

```
2017-03-31 23:14:53.278493 test-ogles_gpgpu[66374:19119633] [General] ERROR: Setting <GLFWContentView: 0x100c2dd10> as the first responder for window <GLFWWindow: 0x100b0b3a0>, but it is in a different window ((null))! This would eventually crash when the view is freed. The first responder will be set to nil.
(
	0   AppKit                              0x00007fffba1f8114 -[NSWindow _validateFirstResponder:] + 566
	1   AppKit                              0x00007fffb99747ff -[NSWindow _setFirstResponder:] + 31
	2   AppKit                              0x00007fffb9a1ca22 -[NSWindow _realMakeFirstResponder:] + 406
	3   AppKit                              0x00007fffb9a1c838 -[NSWindow makeFirstResponder:] + 123
	4   test-ogles_gpgpu                    0x0000000100106dee createWindow + 1230
```

When this is merged I'll need a release and I can submit a PR for the corresponding hunter update w/ new default version=3.3.0.

issue.title: Fix OpenGL Core for OSX

repository.name: GWork

issue.body:
Fails, as described here: https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/876

- Operating System (name & version): OSX 10.12
- Compiler (name & version): clang
- Target renderer: OpenGL Core
- cmake command-line used: `-GXcode -DRENDER_OPENGL_CORE=ON`
